description:
Larimichthys crocea, commonly known as the large yellow croaker or Chinese yellow croaker, is a species of marine fish belonging to the family Sciaenidae. This species is native to the western Pacific Ocean, found along the coastlines of China, Japan, and Korea.

The large yellow croaker is a demersal fish, typically inhabiting coastal waters and estuaries at depths ranging from 10 to 150 meters. It is a medium-sized fish, typically reaching lengths of 30 to 50 centimeters. The species is characterized by a yellowish-brown color on the dorsal side, with a lighter yellowish-white ventral side.

Larimichthys crocea is an economically important species, being a commercially valuable food fish. It feeds primarily on small crustaceans, mollusks, and small fish. The species is known to be an important component of the coastal marine ecosystem, playing a role in the food web and nutrient cycling.

Due to overfishing and other environmental factors, the population of the large yellow croaker has declined significantly over the past few decades. Conservation efforts and management strategies have been implemented to help ensure the sustainability of this species.
